description: The CreateRuleGroupsNamespace operation creates a rule groups namespace within a workspace. A rule groups namespace is associated with exactly one rules file. A workspace can have multiple rule groups namespaces. Use this operation only to create new rule groups namespaces. To update an existing rule groups namespace, use PutRuleGroupsNamespace.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Case-sensitive. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The rules file to use in the new namespace. Contains the base64-encoded version of the YAML rules file. For details about the rule groups namespace structure, see RuleGroupsNamespaceData.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name for the new rule groups namespace.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The list of tag keys and values to associate with the rule groups namespace. (string) --- The key of the tag. Must not begin with aws:. (string) --- The value of the tag.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to add the rule groups namespace.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the new rule groups namespace.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the new rule groups namespace.

nested_items.name: statusCode
nested_items.description: The current status of the namespace.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the failure, if any.
